summary: This document appears to be a forwarded email chain from August 15, 2019, containing a log of Jeffrey Epstein's status and observation details while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It details periods of staff watch, inmate companion supervision, and psychology observation in July 2019, shortly before his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate referenced by the log number #76318-054, whose status, watch, and psychology observations are being tracked in the document.

events.title: Epstein placed on staff watch
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was placed on staff watch starting at 1:40 am, with an inmate companion taking over at 7:00 am.

events.title: Epstein changed to psychology observation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's status was changed to psychology observation at 8:45 am.

events.title: Psychology observation ended
events.description: Psychology observation for Jeffrey Epstein ended at 8:15 am.

events.title: Previous psychology observation began
events.description: A previous period of psychology observation for inmate #76318-054 (Epstein) began at 6:00 pm.

events.title: Previous psychology observation ended
events.description: The previous psychology observation for inmate #76318-054 (Epstein) ended at 9:00 am.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center New York New York 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was under specific monitoring protocols, including 'staff watch' and 'inmate companion' supervision, while in custody.
Epstein was placed on psychology observation at least twice in July 2019, with periods from July 8-10 and July 24-30.
The document is dated August 15, 2019, which is shortly after Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, suggesting it is part of post-incident record-keeping or inquiry.
The document references Epstein's inmate number: #76318-054.
A Forensic Psychologist with the U.S. Public Health Service is associated with the facility, though not named in the provided text.
